Also recall his alleged role in the conversations with Kislyak about setting up a secure back channel to Kremlin leadership using Russian communications gear takes on a new light; his participation in the so-called "Clinton dirt/Magnitsky Act/Adoption" meeting with Natalia Veselnitskaya; and his association with Sergei Gorkov, the FSB-trained banker who reportedly gave Kushner a bag of dirt from the Motherland when they first met.
If it is true Kushner directed Flynn to contact the Russians, you can bet he is now under the spotlight.
One event is more than enough circumstantial activity to make you wonder.
All of it together certainly starts to smell like a conspiracy.
Oh, to be a fly on the Special Counsel's wall.
